solution_line_template: The total number of people transported in the first trip is {passengers_one_way} one way + {passengers_return} on the return trip = <<{passengers_one_way}+{passengers_return}={first_round_trip_total}>>{first_round_trip_total} people.

If the train made three more round trips that day carrying the same number of passengers in each trip as the first, it carried a total of {additional_round_trips}*{first_round_trip_total} = <<{additional_round_trips}*{first_round_trip_total}={additional_trips_total}>>{additional_trips_total} in all three round trips.

In total, the train carried {first_round_trip_total}+{additional_trips_total} = <<{first_round_trip_total}+{additional_trips_total}={total_passengers}>>{total_passengers} people over all its trips that day
